alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 11 at 3:55AM MST until March 11 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MST TO 5 PM MST FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND AREAS EAST OF THE CENTRAL MOUNTAIN CHAIN DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES, AND DRY FUELS... .As the jet stream moves over New Mexico today, strong winds will develop over much of the state. Some of the strongest winds will be found east of the central mountain chain where gusts of 50 to 60 mph are forecast. In addition to these strong to damaging winds, low humidity and above normal temperatures are expected, leading to critical fire weather conditions. Any grassfires that develop will be capable of spreading rapidly. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 11 AM this morning to 5 PM MST this afternoon. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Highlands (Zone 123), Northeast Plains (Zone 104), Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106), Central Highlands (Zone 125) and East Central Plains (Zone 126) from 11 am through 5 pm MST. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 25 to 40 mph with gusts of 50 to 60 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Dropping to 15 to 25 percent this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains
